List¶

Easy list (ul and ol) styling.

Options to set list layout, spacings, indents and block elements. Ability to apply styles according to the list level.

Lists styled with these mixins can be aligned with Alignment.

SASS¶

@mixin list-level($level,$up:true) { @content; }

Styles will be applied to the given $level. If $up is set to true, styles are also applied to sub-levels. Should be applied to an ul or ol element.

$level

The list level. 0 is the root level.

$up

Indicates whether styles are applied to sub-levels or not.

@mixin list-layout($type)

Sets the list layout. List-style and margin/paddings are resetted. Neccessary for all other list mixins to work properly. Should be used as a list-level content.

$type

The type. Possible values:

horizontal

Horizontal list. Includes a workaround (see source for details) which can lead to unexpected behaviour. If this is a problem, use horizontal-nofix, horizontal-fl or horizontal-fr instead (not supported, see source for details).

vertical

Vertical list.

@mixin list-gutter($type,$spacing...)

List-specific gutter mixin, should be used instead of gutter in lists. Should be used as a list-level content.

Uses non-standard CSS, see source code for details.

$type

inner or outer; outer gutter is the padding of li elements, inner gutter of block elements (see list-blicklink mixin) inside li elements.

$spacing...

Spacing, see Gutter.

@mixin list-structure-spacing($spacing)

Indent for the child list level. Should be used as a list-level content.

$spacing

A number indicating the indent.

@mixin list-blocklink()

Makes all child elements of li elements a block element (eg display:block;). Should be used as a list-level content.
